result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: TRANSCRIPT 4-18-22 PLEA HEARING
Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
TRANSCRIPT 9-1-22 SENTENCING HEARING

2:44 PM Defendant Glen A. Fifer in court, in custody from the Clark County Jail.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Glen A. Fifer.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. State has no corrections or changes to PSI. Court has one correction on PSI, page 1 offense date stated it was 09/01/2019 and corrected to 09/01/2009. 
2:46 PM State argument/statement 
2:58 PM Victim Coordinator read victims statements
3:06 PM Father of victim statement
3:11 PM Defense had corrections/clarifications to PSI. Defense argument/statement
3:32 PM Defendants statement
3:33 PM Courts comments 
Count 1: IC - 6 ES - 10; Count 2: IC - 6 ES - 10 Case 22CF08 - DRI
Notice of Hearing - Attempted not known
Sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:57 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Glen A. Fifer, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Victims are appearing by telephone. Plea questionaire was filed with the Court. 22CF08 will be dismissed and read in. Case 19CF84 both counts are amended.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of amended information.   Waived reading of Amended Information.   Defendant pleas no contest. Rights given. Court finds that she has entered her plea knowingly, intelligently and of her own free will and finds the defendant guilty. PSI is requested and Ordered. State request a Sex offender assessment. State request bond be revoked. Court orders bond revoked.
Arraignment on April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Glen A. Fifer, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.    Waived reading of Information  The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.  A Substitution of Judge will be filed later today.
Arraignment on March 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:43 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Glen A. Fifer, appeared in custody from Clerk County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.    Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own freewill and accepts the waiver and binds the case over for further proceedings.  Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.   Court has no objection to joinder.  Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:19 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Glen A. Fifer, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint.  Asking for a preliminary hearing in the time limits  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
regarding Motion to Join
